summary: The No Budget, No Pay Act, introduced in the Senate, aims to incentivize Congress to pass a budget and appropriations bills on time. It stipulates that if Congress fails to approve a concurrent budget resolution and pass regular appropriations bills by October 1st of each fiscal year, members of Congress will not receive pay. The bill outlines the process for determining compliance and the responsibilities of the Budget and Appropriations Chairs in both the House and Senate. The Act specifies the effective date as September 29, 2027, and does not provide for retroactive pay.
